intro: Metrosideros viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of bright green flowers. The plant is typically found growing in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Metrosideros viridiflora is a hardy species that thrives in temperate climates with adequate sunlight.
